author: marekm3498
content:
We found a difference between Geth and Nethermind, but it only occurs when Pectra is scheduled in the genesis block, so it's not critical. https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind/issues/8223

Nethermind performs system calls in the genesis block, while Geth does not.The specification does not mention any exceptions for the genesis block, so calling system contracts seems reasonable. 

I'm fine with either approach, but what is the reasoning behind not executing system calls in the genesis block? <@360491619402776577> <@543900561460822016> ?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I think our idea is that the genesis block is a static block that does not contain any logic. You also wouldn't execute any transactions within the genesis block imo

author: marekm3498
content: I see and understand, but it's a bit annoying that the genesis block is not specified (to my knowledge). In Nethermind, we usually adjust it to match Geth's genesis block behavior after debugging some issues. We could consider specifying it, but of course, it's low priority thing.
